poem:
**Standstill Symphony**

In the halls of locked doors, echoes of resolve,  
Schumer wades through silence, a maestro of stillness.  
Stalemates strung on wires, high tensions taut,  
Where promises waver, the notes of a long ballad.  
Republicans crescendo, disbelief their refrain,  
While Democrats, like statues, refuse to dance.  
Politics: a stage of unmet applause.
prompt: You are the poet Simon Armitage. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Democrats refuse to fold over shutdown as Republican outrage builds When he sat down to talk about the US government shutdown with reporters from a closely read political newsletter this week, Chuck Schumer sounded as if he was relishing his standoff with the Republicans. “Every day gets better for us,” he told Punchbowl News. As the shutdown got under way, Schumer explained, the Republicans believed that Democrats would quickly fold and vote to reopen the". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
